result.execSummary:
The defendant Bradley E. Rogers was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Bradley E. Rogers is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Bradley E. Rogers was found guilty of Child Enticement-Expose Genitals/Pubic Area/Intimate Parts, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.07(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  Submit to a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
*  Pay resitution plus surcharges; the State shall have 60 days to determine restitution.
Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to establish paternity and/or to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action.  Do not reside with any person in any place in which children reside unless you are related to them by blood or marriage.  May not have contact with KNC (dob 6/29/97), unless otherwise permitted by the court.  May not have contact with any minors, unless otherwise permitted by the agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  Participate in and follow recommendations of a sex offender treatment assessment.  Participate in the creation of a realistic care plan and any programming related to the associated goals and identified criminogenic needs.
*  Make payments for court obligations and supervision fees.
Register as a sex offender.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney William Michel.  Clerk: PT
State is compliant with victim rights notification and victim is present in court.  Statement given by victim's mother.  Sentencing arguments made.  DE is sentenced to 9 years in the WSP forthwith with credit for 263 days; 4 years Initial Confinement followed by 5 years Extended Supervision.  DE is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program.  Restitution is to be determined and State shall have 60 days to determine restitution.  No contact with KNC, DOB: 6/29/97 unless permitted by the court only.  See conditions.  Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning & Voting Acknowledgement given.

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Attorney William Michel appeared on behalf of Defendant who is in custody and not in court  Clerk: PT
DE's appearance is waived as the PSI has not been completed by the agent who is requesting additional time.  Parties agree to adjourn sentencing on ADA Bingers off week.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 7, 2015 at 11:30 am.
received from Barb Hess @ DOC

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared specially for Atty Tom Binger and for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney William Michel.  Clerk: PT
State is compliant with victim rights notification and case is resolved.  Count 1 - DE pleads Guilty; found guilty by the court.  Counts 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7 & 8 are Dismissed by the State.  PSI ordered for Sentencing on 9/11/15  at 11:30 AM.

NO RECORD TAKEN:  Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State. Attorney William Paul Michel appeared.  Clerk: PT
